comments.content:
Another sample, though not sure they are all the same font.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418223757im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PotiMakng_6181.jpg)

Didn’t find any exact matches, only similar typefaces:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/sutro-shaded/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418223757/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/sutro-shaded/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/sutro-shaded/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/country-western/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418223757/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/country-western/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/country-western/") [Open]

If your sample predates the 1980s, there may not be a digital equivalent....

This some variation of Clarendon, which resembles the Egyptian [once known as Antique] but has bracketed rather than rectangular [slab] serifs.  
Not an abundance of this style with height to width proportions similar to your image.  
Consider:  
Thorowgood

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418223757im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ThorowgoodAsGOTIA_4129.gif)
  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/thorowgood/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418223757/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/thorowgood/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/thorowgood/")  
Consort ExtraBold CondensedRR
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418223757im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ConsortRRExtraBoldcondAsGOTIA_6248.gif)
  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/consort-rr/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418223757/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/consort-rr/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/consort-rr/")  
CA Normal Serif Extra Bold 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418223757im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CANormalSerifExtraBoldAsGOTIA_5108.gif)
  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/capearcona/ca-normal-serif/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418223757/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/capearcona/ca-normal-serif/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/capearcona/ca-normal-serif/")  
Don

BTW I concur in the suggestion of Country Western as a narrow Clarendon design, with the added feature of a shadow.  
Don

Great suggestions! Thank you kthomps5 and donshottype. I agree with you both that Font Mesa's Country Western Open is possibly the best match I'll find. I am beginning to think it is actually a true letterpress font.  
But all of your suggestions are truly appreciated. Find-My-Font did not suggest CA Normal Serif Extra Bold or Consort ExtraBold CondensedRR.
